meanings.definition: To give shelter or refuge to
meanings.sent1: The kind family was harbouring a stray kitten in their garage.
meanings.sent2: The lighthouse was harbouring ships during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The cozy cabin was harbouring a secret treasure map under the floorboards.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was harbouring a deep love for the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The old tree was harbouring a family of birds in its branches.

meanings.sent1: The jar was harbouring a collection of colorful marbles.
meanings.sent2: The backpack was harbouring all the necessary supplies for the hike.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious box was harbouring a surprise gift for her birthday.
meanings.sent4: His mind was harbouring a multitude of creative ideas.
meanings.sent5: The cloud was harbouring a storm ready to burst with rain.

meanings.definition: To entertain or nourish (a thought or feeling)
meanings.sent1: She found herself harbouring doubts about the upcoming test.
meanings.sent2: He was harbouring a sense of excitement for the upcoming concert.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was harbouring a hilarious joke for his next performance.
meanings.sent4: The book was harbouring a twist that would surprise the readers.
meanings.sent5: The garden was harbouring a sense of tranquility in the midst of chaos.
